alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 18 at 10:47AM PST until November 18 at 11:30AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, San Luis Obispo. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor roadway and small stream flooding will likely continue, especially in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1036 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated bands of moderate to locally heavy rainfall continuing across the advisory area, mainly from Morro Bay to San Simeon and the adjacent foothills. Rainfall rates between 0.25 and 0.75 inches per hour have been common, with local rates up to 1.00 inch per hour near San Simeon where a flash flood warning was issued. This additional rainfall will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Paso Robles, Morro Bay, Atascadero, Cambria, Point Piedras Blancas, Cayucos, Lake Nacimiento, Templeton, Baywood-Los Osos, Hearst Castle, Santa Margarita and Highway 101 over Cuesta Grade. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
